title: Diffusion on syntax trees for program synthesis
dot:
digraph TreeDiffusion{layout=dot;rankdir=TB;node[shape=plaintext];title[label=< Tree Diffusion
Diffusion On Syntax Trees For Program Synthesis >];authors[label=< Authors:
Shreyas Kapur, Erik Jenner, Stuart Russell
University of California, Berkeley >];links[label=< Paper | arXiv | Code & Weights >];abstract[label="Abstract: Neural diffusion models edit syntax trees to synthesize programs informed by execution output."];diffusion[label=< Diffusion Process:
Large language models generate one token at a time.
Neural models suggest edits based on execution outputs.
Utilize neural diffusion to apply and invert noise on syntax trees. >];application[label=< Applications:
- Inverse Graphics: Converts images into programs.
- Program Space Search: Finds the best program with minimal search layers. >];images[label=< Images/Sketches:
>];noise[label=< Add Noise:
Random mutations in the syntax tree via node replacement. >];reverse_noise[label=< Reverse Noise:
Use of search in program space to identify optimal solutions. >];citations[label=< Citation: Kapur et al. 2024.
Diffusion On Syntax Trees For Program Synthesis.
CC BY-SA 4.0 License >];title->authors;authors->links;links->abstract;abstract->diffusion;diffusion->application;application->images;application->noise;noise->reverse_noise;reverse_noise->citations;}
